intro: Ctenodon rosei, commonly known as the rose spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, often hairy stems and leaves that are typically green to reddish in color. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers surrounded by modified leaves called cyathia, which are typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Ctenodon rosei is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate drought conditions.
